meanings.sent1: The fireplace left a fuliginous trail on the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The old chimney emitted a fuliginous cloud of smoke.
meanings.sent3: The fuliginous cat tried to hide in the shadows but stood out against the white wall.
meanings.sent4: Her fuliginous thoughts clouded her mind like a dark haze.
meanings.sent5: The fuliginous sky at dusk painted the horizon in shades of gray and black.

meanings.sent1: The room had a fuliginous atmosphere due to the lack of windows.
meanings.sent2: The forest became fuliginous as the sun set behind the trees.
meanings.sent3: The fuliginous mood of the painting gave it a mysterious allure.
meanings.sent4: His fuliginous past haunted him like a shadow in the night.
meanings.sent5: The fuliginous clouds loomed ominously over the town, signaling an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: The meaning of the poem was fuliginous, leaving the students puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The lake appeared fuliginous under the overcast sky.
meanings.sent3: His fuliginous explanation only added to the confusion of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The truth was hidden in the fuliginous depths of his words.
meanings.sent5: The fuliginous intentions of the character were finally revealed in the last chapter.
